oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anderson mobility gap probed by dynamic coherent backscattering
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cobus, L. A.
Skipetrov, S. E.
Aubry, A.
van Tiggelen, B. A.
Derode, A.
Page, J. H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We use dynamic coherent backscattering to study one of the Anderson mobility gaps in the vibrational spectrum of strongly disordered three-dimensional mesoglasses. Comparison of experimental results with the self-consistent theory of localization allows us to estimate the localization (correlation) length as a function of frequency in a wide spectral range covering bands of diffuse transport and a mobility gap delimited by two mobility edges. The results are corroborated by transmission measurements on one of our samples.
